channel.title: Valt - Making Passwords Painless
channel.description: Recent content on Valt - Making Passwords Painless

item.title: Valt = Security + Usability
item.description: Valt = Security + Usability At Valt we know that usability is essential to security. An impenetrable encryption protocol doesn’t help anybody out if nobody uses it. That’s why we designed Valt Passwords from the ground up to both protect and delight. It starts with your first experience using Valt. Instead of authenticating with a text-based password that’s either hard to remember or easy to guess, we use images.

item.title: Contact us
item.description: Email Write to support@valt.io for personalized help from the very people who built the Valt app from the ground up. Email feedback@valt.io to help us make our products as excellent as they can be! App Store We read every review on the App Store. If you write to us on either the Mac App Store or the iOS App Store, we’ll see it and reply if needed. Plus, your reviews help out everyone: others downloading our app deserve your honest opinion so that they can make educated decisions, and Valt grows faster when more people endorse our work.

item.title: Browser extension
item.description: Enable the extension Safari Verify that you have installed the Mac app. Open Safari. Select Safari → Preferences from the menus on the upper left. Within the popup, select Extensions from the menu bar. In the left hand pane, find Valt and click the checkbox to toggle the extension on or off. When enabled, the Valt icon appears just left of the search bar in the browser window.

item.title: Backup and syncing
item.description: What are backups? Having a backup means that should anything happen to your device, you can recover all of your data from the Valt Cloud. A backup is an encrypted copy of your data held in a separate, safe location. When you enable backup and syncing, we package up your passwords into an encrypted block that can only be decrypted with your 12 word Valt Secret, and send them off to the Valt Cloud.

item.title: Installing Valt
item.description: iOS App We support iPhones, iPads, and iPod touches running iOS >10.0. Visit Valt’s App Store page on your iOS device. Select GET, and enter your Apple ID password. Mac App We support all Apple computers running macOS >12.2 (all versions on or after Sierra). Visit Valt’s App Store page on your computer. Select GET, and enter your Apple ID password. Safari Browser Extension The Safari Browser Extension is installed automatically when you download the macOS app.

item.title: Managing your subscription
item.description: Subscribing to Valt Premium Open Valt on any device. Select the gear icon in the top right corner to open settings. If you’re on iOS, select Account. Mac users go to the next step. Select Purchase Subscription. If you haven’t provided one, Valt will ask for an email. Select how often you want your subscription to renew. Your first 30 days are free no matter your choice.

item.title: Recovery
item.description: Forgotten images Use your recovery code to unlock your Valt. We provided you with a recovery code for safe keeping when you first learned your images. It has the form ABC-DEF-GHI. If you do not have your recovery code, you may have to reset your Valt. Open Valt. Select the first aid kit on the bottom left. On iOS, swipe left until you see “I forgot my images”.

item.title: Memory Boost
item.description: Valt Passwords challenges you to beat us at our own new game. When you play a round, we display a randomized grid of Valt’s curated images. In each row, exactly one of the images is yours. The goal is to accurately select your image as fast as possible from each row. We’ll time you. Our intern, John Karabinos, can do it in 15.13 seconds. If you can beat him—or even come close—tweet in our direction with the #beatjohn tag!

item.title: Contextual Gestures Re-innovated
item.description: Contextual Gestures Re-innovated Starting now, Valt passwords pays attention to your gestures. From your list of accounts on your iOS device, swipe right or left on any one of them to reveal action buttons for copy username, view password, and copy password. If you’re in a hurry, swipe swiftly to the right, and we’ll copy your username straight away. Swipe deliberately to the left, and we’ll copy your password with no questions asked.

item.title: Dual-Coding Theory
item.description: Dual-Coding Theory 100 years ago in a galaxy not so far away, humans discovered that remembering images is easier and faster than remembering text. Despite this fact, billions of online accounts are guarded by strings of letters. To make matters worse, we are constantly advised to choose unique, long, and random character strings that are impossible to remember, one for each of our online accounts. Twenty years ago, researchers showed that more than 27% of people forget their passwords regularly and more than 81% of people forget one or more of their online passwords at least once.

item.title: Valt :: Someone's Wrong on the Internet
Valt :: Someone's Wrong on the Internet
Valt Holiday Guide to Security
item.description: Valt Holiday Guide to Security Holidays: More shopping, more traveling, more exposure of your most sensitive data. Below is our gift to you: how to keep your most critical information safe — so you can spend more time crafting cocktails and less time double-and-triple-checking your online statements for fraud. While now is a time to celebrate with loved ones, it can also be party season for hackers. Below is our guide to staying secure, while you pop the bubbly.

item.title: What Makes an Image Memorable?
item.description: What Makes An Image Memorable? Many believe memorability is subjective – i.e. the same Facebook pictures will stand out for some but fade away for others. Yet decades of research have proven this false. The ability of an image to stick with someone over time is actually a function of its subject(s) and composition. Studies show we remember images in proportion to how distinct they are. Strange, counterintuitive pictures will make an impact—e.
Thanks for listening to Just in Time. Use the link to download Valt!

item.title: Introducing Valt
item.description: Introducing Valt You shop online, you pay your taxes online, you order food online and you talk to your friends online. Let’s face it, the details of your life are stored online. Now ask yourself, how many online accounts do you have? Is it 20? 30? 50? You might be surprised, but on average people have almost 140 accounts online and by 2020 it will exceed 200. That’s a boatload of usernames and passwords.

item.title: Recognition Memory
item.description: Recognition Memory Take a quick look at the six images below. Now go back and imagine a single word description for each one. Really, do it. Let me guess, Dancer, Wedding, Sunflower, Owls, Camera, Street. Okay, five out of six ain’t bad. At Valt, we know that humans are extraordinarily good at recognizing images they’ve seen before. In fact, this is one reason Valt is so secure.

item.title: Simpler Security: Single and Personalized Grids
item.description: Simpler Security: Single and Personalized Grids Valt’s fundamental design philosophy is simple: security products must be usable to be effective. The strongest security platform in the world doesn’t help anyone when nobody uses it. In support of this guiding principle, we’re pleased to announce two new changes to Valt––single grid authentication and personalized grids. Single Grid Authentication New Valt users will now unlock using a single grid. You can either construct a grid using your own images (see below for more details) or you can use our curated set.

item.title: Privacy
item.description: Privacy policy This privacy policy governs your use of the software application Valt Visual Password Manager (“Application”) for mobile devices that was created by Valt Inc. The Application allows users to leverage their visual memory to keep sensitive information like passwords secure. What information does the Application obtain and how is it used? User Provided Information The Application obtains the information you provide when you download and register the Application. Registration with us is optional.

item.title: FAQ
item.description: Frequently Asked Questions This FAQ offers short answers to popular questions. Detailed answers and additional support are also available here. Overview What is Valt? Valt is a new approach to password management—one that is visual and fun—that gives you the freedom to surf without worry or distraction. Instead of remembering hundreds—shudder—of passwords for each website you visit, you can store them all within the safety of your Valt. We use NSA-approved encryption to securely lock your data behind a single truly random master password.

item.title: FAQ
item.description: Frequently Asked Questions What is Valt Visual Password Manager? Valt Visual Password Manager is an iPhone app that provides a new approach to password management. It leverages your visual memory to keep your sensitive passwords secure. The images you learn via specific prompts on each image translate into a master password, which is used to unlock your Valt where all of your passwords are stored. How do I use it?
